headline: Expression of a cellulose-response gene in Neurospora crassa
one_paragraph_summary:
Summary of gene expression across experiments: This gene in Neurospora crassa displays notable expression changes across various environmental and developmental conditions.
  • It is upregulated in response to cellulose-like substrates, such as Avicel, cellobiose, and plant straws, indicating a role in plant biomass degradation.
  • The gene is also influenced by developmental processes, with elevated expression during perithecia and conidia development.
  • In mutants for regulatory genes and environmental changes, its expression suggests adaptive modulation in response to external stimuli.
The collective data suggests this gene may be involved in the metabolism of plant-derived carbon sources and developmental regulation.
